titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Henry Cord Meyer Papers, 1915-1963
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Henry Cord Meyer Papers,
did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, conference papers, notes, speech, memorandum, printed matter, and sound recordings, relating to miscellaneous aspects of twentieth-century European, especially German, history, and to the ideas of the German nationalist writer Paul Rohrbach. Includes sound recordings of World War I songs and of speeches by Winston Churchill, Franklin D. Roosevelt, John F. Kennedy, Joseph Goebbels, Konrad Adenauer and Theodor Heuss.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Henry Cord Meyer papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1969.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: BIOGRAPHICAL FILE, 1943
Two ration books belonging to H. C. Meyer
CORRESPONDENCE, 1942-1947
Holborn, Hajo, 1942
Jackh, Ernest, 1942
Karpovich, Michael, 1942
Rohrbach, Paul, 1947
WRITINGS, 1942-1950
"Rohrbach and His Osteuropa," 1942
"Germans in the Ukraine," 1950. Includes correspondence between Paul Rohrbach and various people, including Fritz August Thiel, Bethmann Hollweg, and Ernst Jackh
SUBJECT FILE, 1936-1963
Croix-de-Feu. Handbills of the French right-wing Croix-de- Feu, attached to a letter by one Max Buhler, relating to the French political scene in 1936
Europe, Eastern. Radio Free Europe reports on various Eastern European countries, 1961-1963
Federal Republic of Germany. Government leaflets urging saving, 1963
Hitlerjugend. Study and organizational chart, n.d.
Luxemburg, Rosa. Article (in Japanese) by Masao Nishikawa, 1960
Nuremberg trials. Address by Eduard Wahl, 1947, and notes (of H. C. Meyer?) on the IG Farben trials, 1948
Rohrbach, Paul. Letter to the editor of Weltbuhne from Siegfried von Vegesack, relating to Paul Rohrbach

Second German-American Conference on Western European Integration and the Future of Eastern Europe, September 8-12, Wiesbaden. Proceedings; remarks of H. C. Meyer; and H. C. Meyer's correspondence relating to the conference
United States. World War II pamphlets put out by the America First Committee and by the Committee for Constitutional Government, Inc.
Von Wiegand, Karl. Photocopy of a letter of F. W. von Meister to Hugo Eckener, dated March 15, 1946, mentioning Karl von Wiegand and Lady Hay
PHONORECORDS
Berlin Bleibt doch Berlin (1949-1953)
Das Dritte Reich in Dokumenten (3 phonorecords)
Die Optimistische Illustrierte
Europe since the War: Ten Years of European Cooperation
FDR Speaks (2 phonorecords)
Graf Zeppelin - Sein Leben und Werk (2 phonorecords)
"I can hear it now...," 1933-1945, a chronicle of war and the years of crisis, narrated by Edward R. Murrow and Fred W. Friendly
J.F. Kennedy - Inaugural Address, 1961
Joseph Goebbels - Das Dritte Reich und Seine Propaganda
Kommodchen-Platte, 1961
Konrad Adenauer - Aus Meinem Leben, n.d. 2 phonorecords)
"It's a Long Way to Tipperary", original songs of World War I, recorded 1915-1919
"Son of Tiperary", original songs of World War I, Vol. II
The Democratic Party: History, Campaigns, Music, narrated by Henry Fonda
Theodor Heuss - Der Mensch und Staatsmann Spricht, n.d.
"Voices toward Peace", n.d., from the Official Archives of the United Nations, narrated by Ralph Bellamy
Winston Churchill - Addresses, 1940
